data.title: Valencia sign Daniel Wass from Celta
data.meta_description:
Valencia have completed the signing of midfielder Daniel Wass from Celta Vigo on a four-year contract, it has been confirmed.
	The Danish midfielder has put pen to paper on a reported €6m deal at the Mestalla ahead of the club’s return to the Champions League next season.
	Back in May, Valencia-based radio programme 90 Minuts that a deal has been agreed between all parties with a deal speeded up due to the player’s contract at Celta expiring in June 2019.
data.text:
Valencia have completed the signing of midfielder Daniel Wass from Celta Vigo on a four-year contract, it has been confirmed.

The Danish midfielder has put pen to paper on a reported €6m deal at the Mestalla ahead of the club’s return to the Champions League next season.

Back in May, Valencia-based radio programme 90 Minuts that a deal has been agreed between all parties with a deal speeded up due to the player’s contract at Celta expiring in June 2019.

At the end of the campaign, the central midfielder hinted at a summer exit by stating: “I have been at Celta for three years and I can now see myself playing in the Champions League somewhere else.”

The 28-year-old has made 130 appearances at Celta following a 2015 move from French club Evian, while he has previously stated he wants to retire at Brondby.
